intro: Astragalus leptus, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are compound, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus leptus plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife in its native range.
